definition: exterior surface/family relationship via females/to show (one's opinion)/a model/a table (listing information)/a form/a meter (measuring sth)

sentences.english: Irony is beginning to make some incursions into the straight-faced bastion of mainstream print media.
sentences.chinese: 反讽正在入侵一些面无表情的主流印刷媒体。

sentences.english: He told hilarious stories in a deadpan voice.
sentences.chinese: 他可以面无表情地用平静的声音讲出笑死人的故事来。

sentences.english: You ask the question and he stares at you blankly.
sentences.chinese: 你向他提问，但他却面无表情的盯着你。

sentences.english: Her apathy since her husband's death worries her children.
sentences.chinese: 自她丈夫去世后，她一直冷无表情，令孩子们很担心。

sentences.english: Are you not blinded by such expressionless sirens?
sentences.chinese: 这些面无表情的水妖没有弄瞎你的双眼吗？

sentences.english: The defendant sat impassively in the dock while evidence was given against him.
sentences.chinese: 在不利证据被出示时，被告面无表情地坐在被告席上。

sentences.english: You feel choked to stay dawn these deadpans.
sentences.chinese: 和那些面无表情的人在一起任务真让人憋气。

sentences.english: Chien displayed no emotion when his sentencing was announced. His relatives cried outside the court house.
sentences.chinese: 阮文海聆判后面无表情，他的亲戚则在庭外痛哭。

sentences.english: Melinda Sordino: My English teacher has no face. I call her Hairwoman.
sentences.chinese: 我的英语老师面无表情，所以我管她叫女飞行员。

sentences.english: The batter and the batboy listened to the story without batting an eyelid.
sentences.chinese: 棒球打击手和球童都面无表情地听着这个故事。
“这是一种惩罚，”杰克逊面无表情。

sentences.english: Never go out of the poker-faced.
sentences.chinese: 从不忘带出门的是面无表情。

sentences.english: This involves uploading an expressionless photo of myself, taken face-on.
sentences.chinese: 这包括上传我一些无表情的正面照片。

sentences.english: The intact figure of the bull looks upon the violence without emotion.
sentences.chinese: 一个完整的公牛形象面无表情地仰望这场暴力。

definition: as if nothing had happened (idiom); calmly/nonchalantly
to have a taut face/to pull a long face/to look displeased
like a smile yet not a smile (idiom)
not to glance sideways (idiom)/to gaze fixedly/to be fully concentrated/to preserve a correct attitude
